posts.title: Manji
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: A dutiful, unhappy lawyer’s wife falls in love with a young, mysterious woman she encounters at an art class. Soon their affair involves her husband and the young woman’s impotent lover and together the four slowly descent into a web of tangled passions. Masumura was the first Japanese student to attend Italy’s prestigious Centro …

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Bolwieser aka The Stationmaster’s Wife (1977)
posts.title: Bolwieser
posts.excerpt: Jim’s Reviews/Fassbinder From Slant: By Fernando F. Croce October 4, 2005 The Stationmaster’s Wife’s first image sets up the template for Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s magnificently excruciating study of romantic degradation-frozen in embrace over the opening credits, newlyweds Xaver (Kurt Raab) and Hanni Bolwieser (Elisabeth Trissenaar) kiss and grope ardently, until she abruptly pushes him away …

posts.title: Mandariinid
posts.excerpt: Plot Autumn in the 1990s. An Estonian village in Abkhazia. Forest-covered hills, the sea, tangerine orchards. The Abkhazian War in Georgia. Two villagers – an old man Ivo and his neighbour Markus – are the only ones who haven’t left. Markus wants to harvest his tangerine plantation, although Ivo is against cropping during wartime. As …

posts._title: Yûzô Kawashima – Shitoyakana kedamono AKA The Graceful Brute (1962)
posts.title: Shitoyakana kedamono
posts.excerpt: Quote: The original story of amazingly greedy people with cheat, embezzle and corruption, is an original, written by Kaneto Shindo. It’s all set in this little apartment of the Maeda family. The son’s taking money from the talent agency that he’s working for. But the money’s somehow missing. Who’s taking it? posts._title: Yasuzô Masumura – Heitai yakuza AKA Hoodlum Soldier (1965)
posts.title: Heitai yakuza
posts.excerpt: A young intellectual conscientious objector is forced to serve with the Japanese army in Manchuria. He joins with a dim-witted former gangster in an effort to desert by stealing a train.

posts._title: Mikio Naruse – Tsuma yo bara no yô ni AKA Wife! Be Like a Rose! (1935)
posts.title: Tsuma yo bara no yô ni
posts.excerpt: The effervescent and charming Chiba Sachiko (Naruse’s wife at the time) plays Kimiko, the bold daughter who travels to the countryside to find her estranged father to seek his consent for her forthcoming marriage . When Kimiko discovers that her father has taken up with a young geisha and is just as difficult as ever, …

posts.title: Aleksandr Nevskiy
posts.excerpt: From Criterion Collection: Eisenstein drew on history, Russian folk narratives, and the techniques of Walt Disney to create this broadly painted epic of Russian resilience. This story of Teutonic knights vanquished by Prince Alexander Nevsky’s tactical brilliance resonated deeply with a Soviet Union concerned with the rise of Nazi Germany. Widely imitated—most notably by Laurence …

posts.title: Psy
posts.excerpt: Synopsis The cartoonist Gerard Lauzier wrote this satire of psychologists, their practice, and the whole idea of group therapy, around Marc (Patrick Dewaere), a psychologist who may need more help than he gives. Right now, Marc is living in the countryside with Colette (Anny Duperey), but not without difficulties. He plans to conduct a group …

posts._title: Robert J. Flaherty & Richard Lyford & Curt Oertel – The Titan: Story of Michelangelo (1950)
posts.title: The Titan: Story of Michelangelo
posts.excerpt: Imdb says: The life and works of the great artist Michelangelo Buonarroti are shown against the historical background of his time. It begins with his earliest artworks, and follows his life and career as he achieves lasting fame. The documentary includes detailed looks at some of the artist’s most renowned creations.
posts.director: Robert J Flaherty & Richard Lyford & Curt Oertel
